metadata.description: Comprehensive Biblical Genealogy Database - Corrected and Complete

adam.name: Adam
adam.bio: The first man, created by God from dust. Name means 'man' or 'earth.' Placed in Eden to tend it. Named all animals. After the fall, expelled from Eden. Father of humanity. Lived 930 years.

eve.name: Eve
eve.bio: The first woman, created from Adam's rib. Name means 'living' or 'mother of all living.' Deceived by the serpent, ate forbidden fruit. Mother of all humanity.

cain.name: Cain
cain.bio: First son of Adam and Eve. Name means 'possession' or 'acquired.' A farmer who killed his brother Abel out of jealousy. Marked by God and became a wanderer. Built the first city, named after his son Enoch.

abel.name: Abel
abel.bio: Second son of Adam and Eve. Name means 'breath' or 'vapor.' A shepherd whose offering pleased God. First murder victim, killed by his brother Cain. Considered righteous.

seth.name: Seth
seth.bio: Third son of Adam and Eve, born after Abel's death. Name means 'appointed' or 'granted.' Through him came the godly line leading to Noah and ultimately to Christ. Lived 912 years.

enoch_cain.name: Enoch (Cain's son)
enoch_cain.bio: Son of Cain, first city named after him. Not to be confused with Enoch who walked with God (descendant of Seth).

irad.name: Irad
irad.bio: Son of Enoch, grandson of Cain. Part of the ungodly line of Cain.

mehujael.name: Mehujael
mehujael.bio: Son of Irad, descendant of Cain.

methushael.name: Methushael
methushael.bio: Son of Mehujael, descendant of Cain.

lamech_cain.name: Lamech (Cain's line)
lamech_cain.bio: Descendant of Cain. First polygamist, married Adah and Zillah. Boasted about killing a man. Father of those who pioneered nomadic life, music, and metalwork.

jabal.name: Jabal
jabal.bio: Son of Lamech and Adah. Father of those who live in tents and raise livestock. Pioneer of nomadic pastoral life.

jubal.name: Jubal
jubal.bio: Son of Lamech and Adah. Father of all who play the harp and flute. Pioneer of musical arts.

tubal_cain.name: Tubal-Cain
tubal_cain.bio: Son of Lamech and Zillah. Forged tools of bronze and iron. Pioneer of metallurgy.

naamah.name: Naamah
naamah.bio: Daughter of Lamech and Zillah, sister of Tubal-Cain. One of few women named in Cain's genealogy.

enosh.name: Enosh
enosh.bio: Son of Seth, grandson of Adam. Name means 'mortal man.' During his time people began to call on the name of the LORD. Lived 905 years.

kenan.name: Kenan (Cainan)
kenan.bio: Son of Enosh. Name means 'possession.' Lived 910 years. Part of the godly line from Adam to Noah.

mahalalel.name: Mahalalel
mahalalel.bio: Son of Kenan. Name means 'praise of God.' Lived 895 years.

jared.name: Jared
jared.bio: Son of Mahalalel. Name means 'descent.' Father of Enoch who walked with God. Lived 962 years.

enoch.name: Enoch (Seth's line)
enoch.bio: Son of Jared. Walked with God and was taken to heaven without dying. Father of Methuselah. Prophesied about the Lord's coming with thousands of holy ones. Lived 365 years before God took him.

methuselah.name: Methuselah
methuselah.bio: Son of Enoch. Name possibly means 'man of the dart' or 'when he dies, it shall come.' Lived longer than any other human: 969 years. Died the year of the flood.

lamech.name: Lamech (Seth's line)
lamech.bio: Son of Methuselah, father of Noah. Prophesied that Noah would bring comfort from the curse. Lived 777 years. Not to be confused with Lamech of Cain's line.

noah.name: Noah
noah.bio: Son of Lamech, tenth from Adam. Name means 'rest' or 'comfort.' Found grace with God in a corrupt generation. Built the ark, saved humanity and animals from the flood. God made a covenant with him. Father of all post-flood humanity. Lived 950 years.

shem.name: Shem
shem.bio: Eldest son of Noah. Name means 'name' or 'renown.' Blessed by Noah. Ancestor of the Semitic peoples including Abraham and the Israelites. Lived 600 years.

ham.name: Ham
ham.bio: Second son of Noah. Name possibly means 'hot' or 'black.' Dishonored his father. His son Canaan was cursed. Ancestor of African and Canaanite peoples.

japheth.name: Japheth
japheth.bio: Youngest son of Noah. Name means 'enlarged.' Blessed to dwell in the tents of Shem. Ancestor of European and some Asian peoples.

elam.name: Elam
elam.bio: Son of Shem. Ancestor of the Elamites who settled east of Mesopotamia (modern Iran area).

asshur.name: Asshur
asshur.bio: Son of Shem. Ancestor of the Assyrians. Built Nineveh and other great cities.

arphaxad.name: Arphaxad
arphaxad.bio: Son of Shem, born two years after the flood. Ancestor of Abraham through the godly line. Lived 438 years.

lud.name: Lud
lud.bio: Son of Shem. Ancestor of the Lydians of Asia Minor.

aram.name: Aram
aram.bio: Son of Shem. Ancestor of the Arameans (Syrians). The Aramaic language spread widely in the ancient Near East.

shelah.name: Shelah (Salah)
shelah.bio: Son of Arphaxad. Part of the line from Shem to Abraham. Lived 433 years.

eber.name: Eber
eber.bio: Son of Shelah. Name means 'beyond' or 'the region beyond.' Ancestor of the Hebrews - the name 'Hebrew' comes from Eber. In his descendant Peleg's time the earth was divided. Lived 464 years.

peleg.name: Peleg
peleg.bio: Son of Eber. Name means 'division' because in his days the earth was divided (possibly referring to the Tower of Babel). Ancestor of Abraham. Lived 239 years.

joktan.name: Joktan
joktan.bio: Son of Eber, brother of Peleg. Father of 13 sons who became Arabian tribes. His descendants settled in the Arabian Peninsula.

reu.name: Reu
reu.bio: Son of Peleg. Name means 'friend.' Part of the line to Abraham. Lived 239 years.

serug.name: Serug
serug.bio: Son of Reu. Name means 'branch.' Lived 230 years.

nahor_1.name: Nahor (Terah's father)
nahor_1.bio: Son of Serug, grandfather of Abraham. Not to be confused with Abraham's brother of the same name. Lived 148 years.

terah.name: Terah
terah.bio: Son of Nahor, father of Abraham. Left Ur of the Chaldees with Abraham but settled in Haran where he died. Worshiped other gods initially. Lived 205 years.

abraham.name: Abraham (Abram)
abraham.bio: Son of Terah. Originally Abram ('exalted father'), renamed Abraham ('father of many'). Called by God from Ur. Father of faith, friend of God. God made covenant promising land, seed, blessing. Justified by faith. Offered Isaac. Father of Ishmael by Hagar, Isaac by Sarah, six sons by Keturah. Lived 175 years.

nahor_2.name: Nahor (Abraham's brother)
nahor_2.bio: Son of Terah, brother of Abraham. Married his niece Milcah. His granddaughter Rebekah married Isaac. Ancestor of the Arameans.

haran.name: Haran
haran.bio: Son of Terah, brother of Abraham. Died before his father in Ur. Father of Lot, Milcah, and Iscah.

lot.name: Lot
lot.bio: Son of Haran, nephew of Abraham. Traveled with Abraham, chose the Jordan plain. Rescued from Sodom's destruction. His wife became a pillar of salt. Father of Moab and Ben-Ammi by his daughters.

moab.name: Moab
moab.bio: Son of Lot by his elder daughter. Ancestor of the Moabites who settled east of the Dead Sea. Ruth was a Moabite.

ben_ammi.name: Ben-Ammi
ben_ammi.bio: Son of Lot by his younger daughter. Name means 'son of my people.' Ancestor of the Ammonites.

ishmael.name: Ishmael
ishmael.bio: Son of Abraham by Hagar, Sarah's Egyptian maidservant. Name means 'God hears.' Sent away with his mother, God promised to make him a great nation. Father of twelve princes. Archer in the wilderness. Ancestor of Arab peoples. Lived 137 years.

isaac.name: Isaac
isaac.bio: Son of Abraham and Sarah, child of promise. Name means 'laughter.' Nearly sacrificed by Abraham. Married Rebekah at 40. Father of twins Esau and Jacob at 60. Blessed Jacob instead of Esau. Only patriarch who never left Canaan. Lived 180 years.

rebekah.name: Rebekah
rebekah.bio: Daughter of Bethuel, sister of Laban, wife of Isaac. Chosen by Abraham's servant as Isaac's wife. Mother of twins Esau and Jacob. Helped Jacob receive the blessing meant for Esau. Buried in the cave of Machpelah.

esau.name: Esau (Edom)
esau.bio: Son of Isaac and Rebekah, twin brother of Jacob. Born red and hairy. Skilled hunter, loved by Isaac. Sold birthright for stew. Lost blessing to Jacob. Married Hittite and Ishmaelite women. Reconciled with Jacob. Father of the Edomites.

jacob.name: Jacob (Israel)
jacob.bio: Son of Isaac and Rebekah, twin of Esau. Name means 'supplanter,' renamed Israel ('prince with God'). Obtained birthright and blessing. Fled to Haran, married Leah and Rachel. Wrestled with God. Father of twelve sons (tribes of Israel) and one daughter. Went to Egypt in old age. Blessed his sons prophetically. Lived 147 years.

leah.name: Leah
leah.bio: Daughter of Laban, older sister of Rachel. First wife of Jacob through deception. Had weak eyes. Mother of six sons and one daughter. Buried in cave of Machpelah.

rachel.name: Rachel
rachel.bio: Daughter of Laban, younger sister of Leah. Beloved wife of Jacob who worked 14 years for her. Mother of Joseph and Benjamin. Died giving birth to Benjamin near Bethlehem. Her tomb became a landmark.

bilhah.name: Bilhah
bilhah.bio: Rachel's maidservant, given to Jacob as a wife. Mother of Dan and Naphtali.

zilpah.name: Zilpah
zilpah.bio: Leah's maidservant, given to Jacob as a wife. Mother of Gad and Asher.

reuben.name: Reuben
reuben.bio: Firstborn son of Jacob and Leah. Name means 'behold, a son.' Lost birthright due to sin with Bilhah. Tried to save Joseph from his brothers. Offered his sons as surety for Benjamin. His tribe settled east of Jordan.

simeon.name: Simeon
simeon.bio: Second son of Jacob and Leah. Name means 'hearing.' With Levi, killed the men of Shechem for defiling Dinah. Kept hostage in Egypt by Joseph. His tribe was absorbed into Judah.

levi.name: Levi
levi.bio: Third son of Jacob and Leah. Name means 'attached.' With Simeon, killed Shechemites. Father of the priestly tribe. His descendants served in the tabernacle and temple. No land inheritance but 48 cities. Lived 137 years.

judah.name: Judah
judah.bio: Fourth son of Jacob and Leah. Name means 'praise.' Suggested selling Joseph rather than killing him. Promised to protect Benjamin. Through Tamar, ancestor of David and Jesus. Royal tribe, held the scepter. His tribe became the kingdom of Judah.

dan.name: Dan
dan.bio: First son of Jacob and Bilhah (Rachel's maid). Name means 'judge.' His tribe settled in far north, later associated with idolatry. Not mentioned in Revelation 7's list of tribes.

naphtali.name: Naphtali
naphtali.bio: Second son of Jacob and Bilhah. Name means 'my wrestling.' His tribe settled in northern Galilee. Region later associated with Jesus' ministry.

gad.name: Gad
gad.bio: First son of Jacob and Zilpah (Leah's maid). Name means 'fortune' or 'troop.' His tribe settled east of Jordan with Reuben and half of Manasseh. Known as warriors.

asher.name: Asher
asher.bio: Second son of Jacob and Zilpah. Name means 'happy' or 'blessed.' His tribe settled along the Mediterranean coast. Known for rich food and royal delicacies. Anna the prophetess was from Asher.

issachar.name: Issachar
issachar.bio: Ninth son of Jacob, fifth by Leah. Name means 'wages.' Born after Leah gave Rachel mandrakes. His tribe settled in fertile Jezreel valley. Known for understanding the times.

zebulun.name: Zebulun
zebulun.bio: Tenth son of Jacob, sixth by Leah. Name means 'dwelling.' His tribe settled in Galilee, became seafarers and traders. Jesus grew up in Nazareth within Zebulun's territory.

dinah.name: Dinah
dinah.bio: Only recorded daughter of Jacob, by Leah. Defiled by Shechem the Hivite, leading to her brothers' revenge and the slaughter of the Shechemites.

sered.name: Sered
sered.bio: Son of Zebulun, founder of the Seredite clan.

elon.name: Elon (Zebulun's son)
elon.bio: Son of Zebulun, founder of the Elonite clan. Distinct from Elon the judge who also came from Zebulun's tribe.

jahleel.name: Jahleel
jahleel.bio: Son of Zebulun, founder of the Jahleelite clan.

joseph.name: Joseph
joseph.bio: Eleventh son of Jacob, firstborn of Rachel. His name means 'may he add.' Beloved by Jacob, given a richly ornamented robe. Dreamed his family would bow to him. Brothers sold him to Midianites for 20 shekels; he was taken to Egypt. Served Potiphar, falsely accused by his wife, imprisoned. Interpreted dreams for Pharaoh's cupbearer and baker, then Pharaoh himself. Made second in command of Egypt at 30. Stored grain during plenty, sold it during famine. Brothers came for food; he tested then revealed himself. Brought Jacob's family to Egypt (70 people). Jacob blessed Joseph's sons Ephraim and Manasseh, crossing his hands. Joseph made brothers swear to carry his bones to Canaan. Lived 110 years. His life pictures Christ—rejected by brothers, exalted, saves his people.

benjamin.name: Benjamin
benjamin.bio: Twelfth son of Jacob, second by Rachel who died giving birth. Name means 'son of my right hand.' Beloved by Jacob after Joseph's apparent death. His tribe produced King Saul and the apostle Paul. Tribe nearly destroyed in civil war but recovered.

manasseh_joseph.name: Manasseh (Joseph's son)
manasseh_joseph.bio: Firstborn son of Joseph by Asenath (daughter of Egyptian priest). Born in Egypt, his name means 'causing to forget'—Joseph said 'God has made me forget all my trouble.' Though firstborn, Jacob crossed his hands and gave the greater blessing to Ephraim. His tribe split: half settled east of Jordan, half west. The eastern half was first taken into exile by Assyria. Gideon, Jephthah came from Manasseh. King Manasseh of Judah was not from this tribe but from Judah.

machir.name: Machir
machir.bio: Son of Manasseh, founder of Machirite clan. His sons conquered Gilead and Bashan. Moses gave Gilead to Machir's descendants. They were known as fierce warriors. Machir's daughter married Hezron of Judah. During David's exile from Absalom, Machir's descendant provided supplies. The territory east of Jordan became known for Machir's clan.

gilead.name: Gilead (Machir's son)
gilead.bio: Son of Machir, gave his name to the region east of Jordan. Founder of the Gileadite clan. Father of six sons who became clan leaders. The balm of Gilead was famous. Jephthah and Elijah were called Gileadites. Jabesh-gilead remained loyal to Saul's house.

jeezer.name: Jeezer (Abiezer)
jeezer.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Jeezerite clan. Gideon came from this clan.

helek.name: Helek
helek.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Helekite clan.

asriel.name: Asriel (Gilead's son)
asriel.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Asrielite clan.

shechem_gilead.name: Shechem (Gilead's line)
shechem_gilead.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Shechemite clan. Distinct from the Canaanite city and the man who violated Dinah.

hepher.name: Hepher (Gilead's son)
hepher.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Hepherite clan. Father of Zelophehad who had only daughters—they successfully petitioned Moses for inheritance rights, establishing precedent for daughters to inherit.

zelophehad.name: Zelophehad
zelophehad.bio: Son of Hepher, from Manasseh's tribe. Died in the wilderness leaving no sons, only five daughters. His daughters (Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, Tirzah) boldly approached Moses asking for inheritance rights. Moses consulted God, who granted their request, establishing that daughters could inherit if there were no sons. They were required to marry within their tribe to keep land in Manasseh. Their courage changed inheritance law for Israel.

mahlah.name: Mahlah
mahlah.bio: Eldest daughter of Zelophehad. One of five sisters who successfully petitioned for inheritance rights when their father died without sons. Married within Manasseh's tribe as required.

noah_zelophehad.name: Noah (Zelophehad's daughter)
noah_zelophehad.bio: Daughter of Zelophehad, one of five sisters who received their father's inheritance. Distinct from Noah the ark builder.

hoglah.name: Hoglah
hoglah.bio: Daughter of Zelophehad, one of the five sisters who changed inheritance law in Israel.

milcah_zelophehad.name: Milcah (Zelophehad's daughter)
milcah_zelophehad.bio: Daughter of Zelophehad, one of the five sisters. Distinct from other Milcahs in Scripture.

tirzah.name: Tirzah (Zelophehad's daughter)
tirzah.bio: Youngest daughter of Zelophehad, one of the five sisters. A city in Canaan was later named Tirzah and became capital of northern Israel.

shemida.name: Shemida
shemida.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Shemidaite clan.

ephraim.name: Ephraim
ephraim.bio: Second son of Joseph by Asenath. Born in Egypt, his name means 'fruitful'—Joseph said 'God has made me fruitful in the land of my suffering.' Though younger, he received the greater blessing from Jacob, who crossed his hands deliberately despite Joseph's protest. His tribe became powerful, often representing the northern kingdom. Joshua was from Ephraim. The tabernacle was at Shiloh in Ephraim for over 300 years. After the split, Jeroboam made Shechem (Ephraim) his capital. 'Ephraim' often refers to the whole northern kingdom. Blessed to be fruitful but often proud and idolatrous.

perez.name: Perez
perez.bio: Son of Judah and Tamar. Twin brother of Zerah. Born first by breaking through, name means 'breach.' Ancestor of David and Jesus through Boaz and Ruth. His descendants became numerous and powerful in Judah.

zerah.name: Zerah
zerah.bio: Son of Judah and Tamar, twin of Perez. Scarlet thread tied on his hand at birth. Ancestor of Achan who troubled Israel at Ai.

hezron.name: Hezron
hezron.bio: Son of Perez, grandson of Judah. Key figure in the line to David. Father of three important lines: Ram (David's line), Jerahmeel, and Caleb.

ram.name: Ram (Aram)
ram.bio: Son of Hezron, in the direct line to David and Jesus. Father of Amminadab.

amminadab.name: Amminadab
amminadab.bio: Son of Ram. Father of Nahshon (prince of Judah during the Exodus) and Elisheba (who married Aaron the high priest). In David's ancestral line.

nahshon.name: Nahshon
nahshon.bio: Son of Amminadab, prince of Judah during the wilderness wanderings. Brother-in-law of Aaron. According to tradition, first to enter the Red Sea. Ancestor of David.

salmon.name: Salmon (Salma)
salmon.bio: Son of Nahshon. Married Rahab the former prostitute of Jericho. Father of Boaz. In the line of David and Jesus.

boaz.name: Boaz
boaz.bio: Son of Salmon and Rahab. Wealthy landowner in Bethlehem. Kinsman-redeemer who married Ruth the Moabitess. Man of noble character. Ancestor of David and Jesus.

ruth.name: Ruth
ruth.bio: Moabite widow who chose to follow Naomi and the God of Israel. Married Boaz. Great-grandmother of King David. Her story shows God's grace to Gentiles. In Jesus' genealogy.

obed.name: Obed
obed.bio: Son of Boaz and Ruth. Name means 'servant.' Grandfather of King David.

jesse.name: Jesse
jesse.bio: Son of Obed, grandson of Boaz and Ruth. Father of eight sons including David. Lived in Bethlehem. The Messiah prophesied as 'root of Jesse.'

david.name: David
david.bio: Youngest son of Jesse. Shepherd, psalmist, warrior, king. Anointed by Samuel, killed Goliath. Man after God's heart despite failures. United Israel, conquered Jerusalem, brought ark there. God promised eternal throne through his line. Father of Solomon. Ancestor of Jesus. Reigned 40 years.
david.scripture: Ruth 4:17, 22; 1 Sam 16-31; 2 Sam 1-24; 1 Kgs 1-2; 1 Chr 11-29; Ps (many); Matt 1:6; Luke 3:31; Acts 13:22; Rom 1:3; Rev 22:16

solomon.name: Solomon
solomon.bio: Son of David and Bathsheba. Name means 'peace.' Wisest and richest king. Built the first temple. Wrote Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, Song of Songs. Had 700 wives, 300 concubines. Heart turned to idols in old age. Kingdom split after his death. Reigned 40 years.

rehoboam.name: Rehoboam
rehoboam.bio: Son of Solomon. Under his harsh rule, kingdom split. Retained only Judah and Benjamin. Reigned 17 years in Jerusalem.

moses.name: Moses
moses.bio: Son of Amram and Jochebed (Levites). Saved from Pharaoh's decree, raised by Pharaoh's daughter. Fled to Midian, called at burning bush. Led Exodus from Egypt. Mediator of Old Covenant, received Ten Commandments. Greatest prophet of Old Testament. Died viewing Promised Land. Appeared at Transfiguration.

aaron.name: Aaron
aaron.bio: Son of Amram and Jochebed, brother of Moses and Miriam. First high priest of Israel, from whom all legitimate priests descended. Spokesman for Moses before Pharaoh. His rod budded to confirm his priestly calling. Made the golden calf when Moses was on the mountain. His sons Nadab and Abihu died for offering unauthorized fire. Died on Mount Hor at age 123 after seeing the Promised Land but not entering due to striking the rock at Meribah.

miriam.name: Miriam
miriam.bio: Daughter of Amram and Jochebed, sister of Moses and Aaron. Prophetess. Watched baby Moses in the basket. Led women in song after crossing Red Sea. Struck with leprosy for challenging Moses' authority, healed after Moses' prayer. Died at Kadesh.

gershon.name: Gershon (Gershom)
gershon.bio: First son of Levi. His descendants were Levites responsible for the tabernacle curtains, coverings, and hangings. They received 13 cities in Israel.

libni.name: Libni
libni.bio: Son of Gershon, head of the Libnite clan among the Levites.

shimei_gershon.name: Shimei (Gershon's line)
shimei_gershon.bio: Son of Gershon, head of the Shimeite clan among the Levites. Distinct from other Shimeis in Scripture.

kohath.name: Kohath
kohath.bio: Second son of Levi, ancestor of Moses, Aaron, and the priestly line. His descendants were responsible for the most holy things of the tabernacle. They camped south of the tabernacle. Through Amram came Moses and Aaron. Lived 133 years. The Kohathites received 23 cities in Israel.

amram.name: Amram
amram.bio: Son of Kohath, married his aunt Jochebed. Father of Moses, Aaron, and Miriam—the three great leaders of the Exodus. Through him came both the priestly line (Aaron) and the prophetic leader who delivered Israel from Egypt (Moses). Lived 137 years.

nadab_aaron.name: Nadab (Aaron's son)
nadab_aaron.bio: Firstborn son of Aaron. He and his brother Abihu offered unauthorized fire before the LORD and were consumed by fire from God's presence on the same day they were ordained as priests. They had no children. Their deaths taught the holiness required in approaching God.

abihu.name: Abihu
abihu.bio: Second son of Aaron. With his brother Nadab, he died for offering unauthorized fire before the LORD. This occurred shortly after their ordination, serving as a severe warning about the holiness required in priestly service. They had no children.

eleazar.name: Eleazar
eleazar.bio: Third son of Aaron, married a daughter of Putiel. After his older brothers died, he became Aaron's successor as high priest. Helped Moses with the second census and assisted Joshua in dividing the Promised Land. Supervised the tabernacle and its holy objects. Father of Phinehas. The high priesthood continued through his line.

ithamar.name: Ithamar
ithamar.bio: Youngest son of Aaron. Survived his brothers' judgment. Supervised Gershonites and Merarites in tabernacle service. His descendants served as priests; Eli came from his line. David organized his descendants into 8 of the 24 priestly courses.

phinehas.name: Phinehas (Eleazar's son)
phinehas.bio: Son of Eleazar, grandson of Aaron. His name means 'bronze serpent' or 'Nubian.' Zealous for God's honor, he killed an Israelite man and Midianite woman during a plague, stopping God's wrath. God made a covenant of perpetual priesthood with him for his zeal. He served as high priest and was consulted about civil war with Benjamin. Lived to see Joshua's death.

abishua.name: Abishua
abishua.bio: Son of Phinehas, high priest. Part of the faithful priestly line through Eleazar and Phinehas.

bukki.name: Bukki
bukki.bio: Son of Abishua, high priest in the line from Aaron to Zadok.

uzzi_bukki.name: Uzzi (Bukki's line)
uzzi_bukki.bio: Son of Bukki, high priest. Distinct from other Uzzis in Scripture.

zerahiah.name: Zerahiah
zerahiah.bio: Son of Uzzi, high priest in the unbroken line to Zadok.

meraioth.name: Meraioth
meraioth.bio: Son of Zerahiah, high priest. Part of the genealogy recorded to establish Ezra's priestly credentials.

amariah_meraioth.name: Amariah (Meraioth's line)
amariah_meraioth.bio: Son of Meraioth, high priest in David's time.

ahitub.name: Ahitub (Amariah's son)
ahitub.bio: Son of Amariah, father of Zadok the high priest. Through him the priesthood was secured in David and Solomon's reign.

zadok.name: Zadok
zadok.bio: Son of Ahitub, high priest during David and Solomon's reigns. Remained faithful to David during Absalom's rebellion and supported Solomon against Adonijah. Anointed Solomon as king. God promised the priesthood would remain in his line. Ezekiel prophesied that Zadok's descendants would serve in the future temple. His name means 'righteous.'

ahimaaz.name: Ahimaaz
ahimaaz.bio: Son of Zadok. A swift runner who served as messenger for David during Absalom's rebellion. He and Jonathan (son of Abiathar) kept David informed of events in Jerusalem. He wanted to carry news of Absalom's death but was sent after a Cushite messenger.

azariah_ahimaaz.name: Azariah (Ahimaaz's line)
azariah_ahimaaz.bio: Son of Ahimaaz, high priest. Distinct from other Azariahs in the priestly line.

azariah_johanan.name: Azariah (Johanan's line)
azariah_johanan.bio: Son of Johanan, high priest who served in Solomon's temple. Possibly the same Azariah who opposed King Uzziah's unauthorized entry into the temple.

amariah2.name: Amariah (Later high priest)
amariah2.bio: High priest, descendant of Azariah. Part of the continuing priestly line.
